attributes.action: Cut costs for the right to place a headstone on graves.
attributes.additional_details: In the UK there is a cost for the right to "Place a headstone on a grave". Buying a headstone is expensive and this added charge adds stress, upset and devastation to the deceases family. Especially when a person has been paying tax all their life. People should have the right to be laid to rest according to their wishes and beliefs. By the government placing is extortionate costs shows no respect for the deceases and is a way for them to try and profit.
attributes.background: I want the government to cut costs for the right to place a headstone on graves, this should be free. People have already paid for the rights to the grave. The charge for the rights to place a headstone by the government can be up to £3000. This is extortionate for a letter signing.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This would be a matter for individual local councils.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
